intro: Sobralia crocea, commonly known as the yellow sobralia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the orchid family, Orchidaceae, and is characterized by its striking yellow-orange flowers. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to trees in its natural habitat. Its leaves are broad and leathery, providing a sturdy structure for the plant. Sobralia crocea is valued in horticulture for its vibrant blooms and adaptability to various growing conditions.
